sentences.en: He the dignity of a great master and the passion of genius paradoxically.
sentences.cn: 一代宗师的庄严面貌与多情才子的深情热诚矛盾地统一在他身上.

sentences.en: In this case, paradoxically, the real free - trade position is to impose tariffs.
sentences.cn: 在这种情况下, 真正的自由贸易立场是对中国轮胎征收关税 —— 这真是自相矛盾.

sentences.en: My parents used to fight like cat and dog yet paradoxically they still loved each other.
sentences.cn: 我父母亲过去一直吵得你死我活,然而反常的是他们仍然彼此爱着.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, another glutamate - booster , D - cycloserine, is being tested not to enhance memory, but to abolish it.
sentences.cn: 矛盾的是, 另一种谷氨酸酯提升剂, D-cycloserine测验表明不能增强记忆, 反而是相反.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, he made use of the past in proportion as they rejected it.
sentences.cn: 说起来有点矛盾, 他却利用了他们所摈弃的过去,一分不多,一分不少.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, it's their parents who make up a big percentage of the buyers.
sentences.cn: 相反, 倒是他们的父母构成了买房人的大多数.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, some of the conditions may relate to the narrowing and the limiting of the subjectivity.
sentences.cn: 但我们还是要谨慎, 不宜过于信赖模糊的好感.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, the only time the court can deliver the subpoena is when all relevant evidences prepared.
sentences.cn: (例子)颇具矛盾的是, 仅当全部相关证据准备妥当时,法庭才能将传票递出.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, the prohibition of liquor caused an increase in alcoholism.
sentences.cn: 矛盾的是，禁酒反而导致酗酒的增加。

sentences.en: Paradoxically, the success has also been frustrating.
sentences.cn: 可是很矛盾地, 这项成功却也令人沮丧.

sentences.en: Paradoxically, the supreme information provider also has the effect of reducing information intake.
sentences.cn: 自相矛盾的是, 最重要的信息提供者同时也是减低信息吸收率的主要力量.

sentences.en: The darkest thinkers may paradoxically be the most cheering.
sentences.cn: 也许看似矛盾,但最悲观的思想家却很可能是最能鼓励人的.

sentences.en: THE one sure way to prolong an animal s life is , paradoxically, to starve it.
sentences.cn: 矛盾的是,延长动物寿命的方法, 竟然是使其饥饿.

sentences.en: To speak paradoxically, the existence of insignificant people has very important consequences in the world.
sentences.cn: 说来似乎近于怪论, 天地间那些无足轻重之人往往产生万分重大的影响.

sentences.en: When you win a battle and your partner submits, you have, paradoxically, lost.
sentences.cn: 当你赢得了一场口角,你的配偶暂时屈服了,而实际上, 与此相反, 你已经输了.

sentences.en: When you win a battle your partner submits, you have, paradoxically, lost.
sentences.cn: 当你赢得了一场口角, 使你的另一半屈服了, 你其实恰恰相反, 是输家了.

words.tran_cn: 矛盾的；诡论的；似非而是的
悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事
自相矛盾地；似非而是地；反常地

trans.tran_cn: 反论， 荒谬， 自相矛盾， 似非而可能是
trans.tran_en: in a way that is surprising because it is the opposite of what you would expect
